history.content:
EE49: Electronics for IoT
Do you know how to use small microcontrollers to automate measurements and send the results wirelessly to the “cloud”? How to build a solar powered weather station? Design a robot that balances on two wheels like a segway?
In EE49, Electronics for the Internet of Things, you do all these things and learn how to build your own IoT projects!
If you want to put into practice what you learn in other EECS courses like 16A/B (not prerequisites), EE49 is for you. The expertise gained may just help you land that (summer or permanent?) job.
Course hours and location: TTh 5-6:30pm, 277 Cory Hall
Please email boser@berkeley.edu if you would like to know more.

https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~boser/49temp/pitch.html
history.subject: EE49: Electronics for Internet of Things Now Open
